newsitem.title: USA: Browning-Ferris lost $295 million, cites charges.
newsitem.headline: Browning-Ferris lost $295 million, cites charges.

text.p: Browning-Ferris Industries Inc., the waste service firm, Thursday reported a loss of about $295 million for the latest quarter after writing down assets that were sold off.
The company said it lost $295.1 million, or $1.47 a share, in its fiscal fourth quarter compared with a year-ago profit of $96 million or 48 cents a share.

Browning-Ferris said it took charges totalling $447 million in the quarter to writedown the sale of its Italian operations and to close recycling facilities. It also wrote off a landfill in Azusa, Calif.
Excluding the special charges, the company said it would have had a profit of $67 million, or 33 cents a share.
The Houston-based company said the special charges taken were part of a strategic shift from an emphasis on external growth to an emphasis on internal growth.
Browning-Ferris' stock was off 62.5 cents at $25.875 on the New York Stock Exchange in morning trading.
